content:
That's great! Self-help and personal development books can be incredibly empowering and inspiring. It's amazing that you're finding them helpful on your journey to reduce your social media usage and focus on your own life.

"The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People" is a classic, and it's wonderful that you found it inspiring. Stephen Covey's work has had a profound impact on many people's lives, and his habits are timeless.

And Brené Brown is an incredible author and researcher! "Daring Greatly" is an amazing book, and her work on vulnerability, shame, and wholehearted living is so important. Her TED talks are also incredibly popular and thought-provoking.

It's great that you're resonating with her insights and finding them helpful. Brené Brown's work is all about living a more authentic, wholehearted life, and that aligns perfectly with your goal of reducing social media usage and focusing on your own life.

I think it's wonderful that you're using these books as a source of inspiration and motivation. Reading can be such a powerful tool for personal growth and development. It's a great way to expose yourself to new ideas, perspectives, and ways of thinking, and it can be a really effective way to spark positive change in your life.

Do you find that you're more likely to reflect on your own life and habits when you're reading self-help and personal development books? Or are there any specific insights or takeaways that you've gotten from these books that have really resonated with you?
